p: There were 1607 individuals from 26 regions of China who completed this survey, and 1599 (99.5%) were included in the analysis participants. Among all participants, 1068 (66.8%) were female, 531 (33.2%) were male; ages ranged from 18 to 84 years old (mean 33.9Â±12.3 years); 914 (57.2%) were married, 685 were unmarried (42.8%); 326 (20.4%) had a history of visiting Wuhan; and 333 (20.8%) had a history of epidemics occurring in their community; 1583 (99.0%) concern with media reports related to the epidemic; 911 (56.9%) feel nervous, 767 (48.0%) feel difficult to control emotion and 612 (38.3%) have epidemic-related dreams in perceived impacts of the epidemic; 547(34.2%) respond with negative coping styles ( Table 1).
